comments: The compositions of n in which each natural number is colored by one of p different colors are called p-colored compositions of n. For n>=1, a(n) equals the number of 47-colored compositions of n such that no adjacent parts have the same color. - _Milan Janjic_, Nov 17 2011Numbers n such that sigma(47*n) = 47*n + sigma(n). - _Jahangeer Kholdi_, Nov 24 2013
